Description.val:
Family of Construction Equipment (FCE) provides for the replacement and Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) of Marine Corps construction equipment. Funding supports equipment to conduct engineer missions such as constructing counter-mobility obstacles, building pioneer roads, establishing survivability positions, development of expeditionary airfields and general engineering support to forward operating bases and lodgment areas. Construction Equipment includes: Airfield Damage Repair (ADR) Kit which is capable of creating useable landing surfaces by new construction or repair of existing facilities. The ADR Kit uses modern development in construction equipment and materials, is easily deployable, flexible enough to work in all geographic locations and environments, and can quickly repair craters and spalls of all sizes.  It also includes the High Mobility Engineer Excavator (HMEE) which is a self-deployable excavation system with attachments to execute a wide range of mobility, counter-mobility, general engineering and survivability missions.  

Family of Material Handling Equipment (FMHE) line is a roll-up line that provides for the replacement and Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) of Marine Corps MHE such as forklifts, cranes, and container handlers.  This budget line item also includes funding for equipment such as the Light Capability Rough Terrain Forklift (LCRTF), Hydraulic Excavator (HYEX), Extendable Boom Forklift Modernization (EBFL-M), Rough Terrain Container Handler (RTCH) SLEP and the Tractor, Rubber Tires, and Articulated Steering, Multiple Purpose (TRAM) SLEP.

Command Support Equipment - Provides for the procurement/replacement of equipment such as Class 3 (Non-industrial) and Class 4 (Industrial) equipment with system unit cost of $250K or greater, to support the operation and mission of United States Marine Corps ground bases, air stations and districts for existing facilities.

Garrison Mobile Engineer Equipment (GMEE) - The Garrison Mobile Engineering Equipment (GMEE) program is a centrally-managed program for the procurement of commercial construction and engineering equipment such as graders, backhoes, cranes and other construction equipment.  It provides logistical support for facilities and road maintenance, force protection barrier construction and airfield engineering.

Material Handling Equipment (MHE) - The Material Handling Equipment (MHE) program is a centrally-managed program for the procurement of a portfolio of replacement equipment such as forklifts, warehouse cranes and platform trucks, to include Rough Terrain Container Handler (RTCH).

Justification.val:
FY2018 Base Appropriation Request: $33.764M (ACTIVE: $31.135M/RESERVE: $2.624M)

Family of Construction Equipment - $21.392M (ACTIVE: $20.119M/RESERVE: $1.273M):  Funds continue to fund the procurement of the Airfield Damage Repair Kits and Integrated Logistics Support for the Family of Construction Equipment programs.  The ADR kit is capable of creating expedient repairs to useable landing surfaces by new construction or repair of existing facilities.  ADR Kit(s) have the capability to support repairs for (6) 10-foot diameter concrete craters and (15) 10-foot diameter asphalt craters as well as 45 spalls.  
 
Family of Material Handling Equipment - $2.492M (ACTIVE: $1.141M/RESERVE: $1.351M):  Funds will procure the All-Terrain Crane (ATC/MAC-50) SLEP and Rough Terrain Container Handlers (RTCH) SLEP to replace non-operational and over-aged cranes and forklifts required to support the operation and mission of the USMC Bases and Stations.  

Material Handling Equipment - $1.710M: Funds procured a portfolio of warehouse tractors, narrow aisle forklifts (4,000 to 20,000 lbs.), warehouse cranes and platform trucks to include Container Handlers to recapitalize over-aged equipment needed for loading, unloading, and movement of supplies at designated ports, warehouses, passenger/cargo terminals and landfills to better support the operation and mission of the USMC Bases and Stations. Additionally, funds will procure equipment used to maintain ranges, training areas and fight wild-land fires. 

Garrison Mobile Engineering Equipment - $3.893M:  Funds procured commercial engineering equipment to replace non-operational and over-aged light, medium or heavy duty tractors, road and runway sweepers, loaders, excavators, bulldozers, and scrapers required to comply with mandates and that will improve readiness for necessary equipment used for construction and maintenance of roads, improvements and maintenance of facilities, ranges, training areas, air fields and maintain landfills to better support the operation and mission of the USMC Bases and Stations.

Command Support Equipment - $4.277M:  Funds procured an emergency power generator for MCAGCC Twenty-nine Palms, CA and one 3D metal printer for Marine Corps Logistics Base, GA.

FY2019 Base Appropriation Request: $59.856M (ACTIVE: $57.574M/RESERVE: $2.282M)

Family of Construction Equipment - $10.218M (ACTIVE: $8.939M/RESERVE: $1.279M):  Funds continue to fund the procurement of the Airfield Damage Repair (ADR) Kits and Integrated Logistics Support for the Family of Construction Equipment programs.  The ADR kit is capable of creating expedient repairs to useable landing surfaces by new construction or repair of existing facilities.  ADR Kit(s) have the capability to support repairs for (6) 10-foot diameter concrete craters and (15) 10-foot diameter asphalt craters as well as 45 spalls.  It will also fund the High Mobility Engineer Excavator (HMEE) which is a self-deployable excavation system with attachments to execute a wide range of mobility, counter-mobility, general engineering and survivability missions.  Funding decreased from FY18 to FY19 by $11.174M due to accelerating the procurement of Air Field Damage Repair Kits while meeting the Approved Acquisition Objectives outlined in the Total Force Structure Management System. 
 
Family of Material Handling Equipment - $33.187M (ACTIVE: $32.184M/RESERVE: $1.003M):  Funds will continue to procure the All-Terrain Crane (ATC/MAC-50) as well as Rough Terrain Container Handlers (RTCH) SLEP to replace non-operational forklifts and modernization efforts, required to support the operation and mission of the Operational Forces and Contingency Operations.  Funding increased from FY18 to FY19 by $30.695M which continues to support the procurement All-Terrain Crane (ATC/MAC-50) SLEP and Rough Terrain Container Handlers (RTCH) SLEP to replace non-operational forklifts and modernization efforts, required to support the operation and mission of the Operational Forces and Contingency Operations, Technical Manuals and Integrated Logistics Support.

Material Handling Equipment - $1.938M:  Funds will procure a portfolio of warehouse tractors, narrow aisle forklifts (4,000 to 20,000 lbs.), warehouse cranes and platform trucks to include Container Handlers to recapitalize over-aged equipment needed for loading, unloading, and movement of supplies at designated ports, warehouses, passenger/cargo terminals and landfills to better support the operation and mission of the USMC Bases and Stations. Additionally, funds will procure equipment used to maintain ranges and fight wild-land fires. 

Garrison Mobile Engineering Equipment - $14.122M:  Funds will procure commercial engineering equipment to recapitalize non-operational and over-aged light, medium or heavy duty tractors, road and runway sweepers, loaders, excavators, bulldozers, and scrapers required recapitalize equipment used for construction and maintenance of roads, improvements and maintenance of facilities, ranges, training areas, air fields and maintain landfills to better support the operation and mission of the USMC Bases and Stations.  Engineer equipment procured for California Bases and Station will comply with mandates California Air Resource Board (CARB), to reduce greenhouse gas emissions over the coming decade while improving air quality. Non-compliance results in fines of $10k per day, per vehicle. 

Command Support Equipment - $0.391M:  Funds will procure Open Water Spill Response boat for MCAS Cherry Point, NC. 

FY2020 Base Appropriation Request: $35.622M (ACTIVE: $33.287M/RESERVE: $2.335M)

Family of Construction Equipment - $11.630M (ACTIVE: $10.320M/RESERVE: $1.310M):  Funds will continue to procure the High Mobility Engineer Excavator (HMEE) which is a self-deployable excavation system with attachments to execute a wide range of mobility, counter-mobility, general engineering and survivability missions.  Funding increased from FY19 to FY20 by $1.412M to continue the procurement of the HMEE.
 
Family of Material Handling Equipment - $15.233M (ACTIVE: $14.208M/RESERVE: $1.025M):  Funds will procure the All-Terrain Crane (MAC-50) as well as Rough Terrain Container Handlers (RTCH) SLEP to replace non-operational forklifts and modernization efforts, required to support the operation and mission of the Operational Forces and Contingency Operations.  Funding decreased from FY19 to FY20 by $17.954M due to a reduction of production quantities as well as the RTCH Technical Manuals and Integrated Logistics Support being completed in FY19.

Material Handling Equipment (MHE) - $2.535M:  Funds will procure a portfolio of warehouse tractors, narrow aisle forklifts (4,000 to 20,000 lbs.), warehouse cranes and platform trucks to include Container Handlers to recapitalize over-aged equipment needed for loading, unloading, and movement of supplies at designated ports, warehouses, passenger/cargo terminals and landfills to better support the operation and mission of the USMC Bases and Stations. Additionally, funds will procure equipment used to maintain ranges, training areas and fight wild-land fires. Funding increased from FY19 to FY20 by $.655M to recapitalize the MHE fleet required to reduce the over-aged replacement backlog, improve material readiness, and support the operation and mission of the USMC Bases and Stations.    

Garrison Mobile Engineering Equipment - $5.788M:  Funds will procure commercial engineering equipment to recapitalize non-operational and over-aged light, medium or heavy duty tractors, road and runway sweepers, loaders, excavators, bulldozers, and scrapers that will improve the readiness for necessary equipment used for construction and maintenance of roads, improvements and maintenance of facilities, and maintain landfills to better support the operation and mission of the USMC Bases and Stations.  Engineer equipment procured for California Bases and Station will comply with mandates California Air Resource Board (CARB), to reduce greenhouse gas emissions over the coming decade while improving air quality. Non-compliance results in fines of $10k per day, per vehicle.

Funding decrease from FY19 to FY20 by $10.2M do to a FY19 Congressional add for High Mobility Engineer Excavators, of which $0.865M will be used for Townsend Bombing Range (TBR)to procure heavy equipment (dozers, graders, tractors, excavators, etc.) to conduct site sustainment, modernize and expand the range to accommodate air-to-ground delivery of precision guided munitions (PGM). 

Funding increased from FY19 to FY20 by $1.866M to recapitalize the engineer fleet required to reduce the over-aged replacement backlog, improve material readiness, and support the operation and mission of the USMC Bases and Stations as well as procure heavy equipment for TBR. 

Command Support Equipment - $0.436M:  Funding will support life cycle replacement of warehouse conveyor system MCB Camp Lejeune, NC.

FiscalYear.@footnote: FY2016 and FY2017 exercising Delivery Orders against Basic Contract

Name.val: 1.9) Family of Construction Equipment Integrated Logistics Support
2.4) Material Handling Equipment Integrated Logistics Support
